page.title: 01Fetteresso Forest-Stonehaven
page.content: This block sits astride the upper catchment of the river Cowie and is comprised almost entirely of mature coniferous forest. The only habitations are the Mergie House & Farm in square 4, the house of Tillybreak (square 3) and Clochanshrels in square 8. The forest is part of Fetteresso Forest, managed by the Forestry Commission, and covers and north towards the River Cowie. The forest has had very little felling up to now. The highest points of the block are the hill of the three stones (290m), which is completely afforested, and the hill of Trusa (321m), the top of which (about 0.75km) is open heather moorland. A small portion of deciduous woodland (birch) is found to the east of the unclassified road in square 4 and covers peat diggings.
